results.title: High Hopes
results.brief_description: Lyn and Patrice leave school with definite plans for their careers. Following long periods unemployed they reassess their aspirations and finally accept jobs they didn’t really want.

results.title: John Lethbridge
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Judi Stack, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
John Lethbridge’s works, his paintings, drawings and sculptural installations develop out of a personal necessity to try to give an order to the rituals and repeating experiences of life that recur in an apparently unordered and random world. His recent work can be described as “Post Conceptual Romanticism”

results.title: A Change of Pace
results.brief_description:
A film about the 1983 Australian Lawn Bowls Championship in Adelaide between Jeff Bradley and Jack Christey. Follows the lives of the players both at home and on the greens in the lead-up to the match.

The film begins and concludes with a promotion of the retirement services offered by the ANZ Bank.

results.title: The Siege of Barton's bathroom
results.brief_description: Elly Barton lives in a barren suburban housing estate where there is only one tree left standing. Now the neighbours want to cut it down, but what no-one seems to understand is that it is Elly’s tree - and she is not going to let anybody touch it. Stars Frankie J. Holden, Max Phipps and Rebekah Elmaloglou.

results.title: The Bowater story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Graham, Bowater and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: A story of industrial growth and enterprise - in 1926 the British company Bowater began making paper as well as selling it, and now owns mills and forests in many parts of the world including Norway, Sweden, USA, France, New Zealand and Australia.

results.title: Fingers of gold
results.creator_credit: Banana Growers Federation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates banana production and distribution in New South Wales. Provides information on such aspects as irrigation, protection from the cold, pests and fungus, harvesting, packing and controlled ripening.

results.title: All is well on the border front
results.creator_credit: Akram Zaatari, Future Television and Lebanon Theater
results.brief_description: A tribute to Godard’s seminal “Ici et Ailleurs” (Here and Elsewhere), video artist Akram Zaatari’s documentary, like its predecessor, critically explores issues of representation within the occupied zone of South Lebanon. Interviews with Lebanese prisoners in Israel illustrate aspects of life under occupation with convincing poignancy. In Arabic with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: All is well on the border front
results.creator_credit_for_label: Akram Zaatari, Future Television and Lebanon Theater
results.description: A tribute to Godard’s seminal “Ici et Ailleurs” (Here and Elsewhere), video artist Akram Zaatari’s documentary, like its predecessor, critically explores issues of representation within the occupied zone of South Lebanon. results.title: High Jump
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching tips for high jump events from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of high jump events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: That's one of my talents
results.brief_description: This program aims to provide school leavers with information about a range of non-traditional occupations and working styles. It shows specific examples of both “alternative” money-generating activities and life style options currently being undertaken by Victorians.
